adjective.description: Of the white or off-white colour of paper.
Denoting a kind of narcissus with pure white flowers; specifically (a) Narcissus papyraceus; (b) a cultivar of N. tazetta.

noun.description: A plant (specifically a narcissus) of a paper-white variety.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Geoffrey Chaucer (c1340–1400), poet and administrator. From paper + white [noun].
